definition: (of a perpetrator, victim, weapon, sum of money etc) to be involved in the case
to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: In other words, somebody involved will be eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，還存在將涉案者排掉的情況。

sentences.english: Police arrested another Hankton cousin in connection with that crime.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了漢克頓另一個涉案表兄。

sentences.english: The nurse involved has been suspended and the head of the hospital reprimanded.
sentences.chinese: 涉案的護士已遭停職處分，醫院的院長也受到懲處。

sentences.english: Valente said that five police officers involved will be subject to charges of attempted murder.
sentences.chinese: 瓦倫特表示，5名涉案警察將受到謀殺未遂罪的指控。

sentences.english: I suggested extending detention periods for drug offenders.
sentences.chinese: 我建議應該延長對毒品涉案人員的拘留時間。

sentences.english: Besides, they seized 10 cars involved in the case and drug money of 120 thousand yuan.
sentences.chinese: 此外，依法扣押了10輛涉案汽車和12萬元的毒資。

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to work out who else at Mr Madoff's firm might have had a hand in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 調查者仍在努力查證麥道夫的公司中的其他涉案者。

sentences.english: The two officers involved have been reinstated.
sentences.chinese: 目前這兩名涉案的警察已恢復原職。

sentences.english: They attacked the circus like a hive of bees and arrested all involved.
sentences.chinese: 於是一窩蜂似地突襲了馬戲團，逮捕了所有涉案人員。

sentences.english: The property involved in the case will go to the public according to laws and regulations.
sentences.chinese: 沒收的這些涉案財產，我們會按照法律規定上繳歸公。

sentences.english: The pub has been ordered to suspend business.
sentences.chinese: 涉案歌舞廳已被責令停業。

sentences.english: He also agreed to forfeit about $2.28 million in money and property.
sentences.chinese: 他還同意上繳約228萬美元的涉案財物。

sentences.english: He said the woman involved in the case repented and was spared stoning.
sentences.chinese: 他還表示，涉案女子因認罪懺悔，免於此刑。

definition: to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to investigate and find out/to ascertain
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
